thread.title: Did he or didn't he? Mark Hamill denies flubbing Star Wars lines
thread.title_full: Did he or didn't he? Mark Hamill denies flubbing Star Wars lines

title: Did he or didn't he? Mark Hamill denies flubbing Star Wars lines
text:
Cox Media Group National Content Desk Did he or didn't he? Mark Hamill denies flubbing Star Wars lines 1:44 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Filed in: Things to Do Things to Do Courtesy Lucas Film, Ltd. Star Wars In Concert Luke Skywalker and C-3PO in a scene from Star Wars IV A New Hope onscreen during Star Wars In Concert. 
The movie may be nearly 40 years old, but fanatics still argue the finer, and not so finer, points of Star Wars. 
One of the biggest debates is whether Mark Hamill flubbed his line after he blows up the Death Star. 
Some believe he says Carrie, when Luke Skywalker greets Princess Leia as he gets out of the X-Wing fighter. 
There are clips like this one on YouTube that some say you can hear him say "Carrie." 
Even this week, only months before the new Star Wars: The Force Awakens film hits theaters, Screen Rant included the supposed flub as one of its top 10 movie outtakes that made it into final cuts. 
Hamill responded to the claims that he made a mistake, going to his Twitter account to explain that he said "There she" not Carrie. TOTAL BS! Actually said "There she..." as in "There she is." Dialogue in that scene was dubbed. In-jokes disallowed! https://t.co/nWLmsLsgpw
